intro: Thesium hookeri var. jarmilae, commonly known as the Jarmilae thesium, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, cylindrical spikes, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in sandy or rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
